data.title: Should the Swedish Royal Family Be Your New Obsession? An Introduction
data.meta_description: Like Prince Harry, Crown Princess Victoria, Princess Madeleine, and Prince Carl Philip also married nonroyals.
data.text:
1 / 8

By now, the world is very, very familiar with Kate Middleton and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex. Nearly all their outfits, appearances, and quotes are chronicled in England and abroad. But there is another European dynastic family filled with young, well-dressed members who are focused on doing good: the Swedish Royal Family.

They may not get a lot of attention on this side of the Atlantic—but Crown Princess Victoria, Prince Carl Philip, and Princess Madeleine could very well be your next royal obsession. Each one of the siblings is married to a commoner, and has a young family of their own. Yes, you may have swooned at the sight of Prince Carl Philip and his wife, Princess Sofia, at their son’s christening last year, but there’s a lot more you should know. Below, an introductory guide to the Swedish Royal Family.

King Carl XVI Gustaf and Queen Silvia Are the Current Heads of the Family

At age 27, King Carl XVI Gustaf became the seventh king of the House of Bernadotte. His father died in a plane crash a year after his birth, so he inherited the crown from his grandfather. Carl Gustaf met his wife, who is now styled as Queen Silvia, at the 1972 Munich Summer Olympics. She was a commoner, and grew up in both Germany and Brazil. She is also the first Swedish royal to have had a career, and worked previously as an interpreter. The couple married in 1976.

Prince Carl Philip Was Born Crown Prince, But Then the Title Switched to His Older Sister Victoria

King Carl Gustaf ascended the throne over his older sisters due to his gender. But during his reign, Sweden’s law of absolute primogeniture was passed. (Absolute primogeniture means that the first-born child, regardless of gender and including an older female heir, takes precedence over a younger one in line for the throne.) At the time, Princess Victoria was 3 years old, and her younger brother, then–Crown Prince Carl Philip, was a baby. The law was made retroactive, meaning that Victoria became Crown Princess.

Crown Princess Victoria Married Her Personal Trainer

On June 19, 2010, Crown Princess Victoria, Duchess of Västergötland, married Daniel Westling. Westling met Crown Princess Victoria while working as her personal trainer, and previously owned a gym as well. Upon their marriage, he gained the title H.R.H. Prince Daniel, Duke of Västergötland.

For her wedding day, Crown Princess Victoria wore an off-the-shoulder gown by Swedish designer Pär Engsheden. She reportedly wore the same crown that her mother had worn on her wedding day, which also took place on June 19. Crown Princess Victoria and Prince Daniel now have two children together, Princess Estelle, who is second in line for the throne, and Prince Oscar.

Princess Madeleine’s Husband Is Technically Not an Official Member of the Royal Family

On June 8, 2013, Princess Madeleine married Christopher O’Neill. The couple met in New York City, where Princess Madeleine was living at the time. O’Neill is a British-American businessman who was born in England, but went to school at Boston University. Unlike Daniel Westling, O’Neill did not take the Bernadotte name. Because of this, and the fact that he declined Swedish citizenship, O’Neill does not hold any royal titles. This also makes him not an official member of the Swedish Royal Family.

On her wedding day, Princess Madeleine, who is also styled as Duchess of Hälsingland and Gästrikland, wore a Valentino gown. The reception featured a pyramidal cake constructed out of macaroons. They now have three children together, Princess Leonore, Prince Nicolas, and Princess Adrienne.

Princess Sofia, Who Is the Wife of Prince Carl Philip, Is a Former Model and Reality TV Star

On June 13, 2015, Prince Carl Philip married his girlfriend Sofia Hellqvist. Hellqvist was already known throughout Sweden from her career as a model and as a reality TV star. On her wedding day, Hellqvist wore a dress by Swedish designer Ida Sjöstedt. The bride and groom both gave emotional speeches during the reception afterwards, and the couple and their guests then dined on pop-rock cakes. Sofia became H.R.H. Princess Sofia, Duchess of Värmland (Prince Carl Philip is also styled as the Duke of Värmland.) The couple has two young sons, Prince Alexander and Prince Gabriel.

Crown Princess Victoria, Prince Carl Philip, and Princess Madeleine Are All Active Members of the Royal Family

All three siblings travel frequently on behalf of the royal family, both inside the country and abroad. When King Carl XVI Gustaf is traveling, Crown Princess Victoria serves as regent. If she too is out of the country, her brother and then sister fulfill the role.
